titleInfo.title: Letter from William Bruce, Resident, Bushire, to the Honourable Mountstuart Elphinstone, President and Governor in Council, Bombay

mods.abstract: In this letter, William Bruce, Resident at Bushire, relays news, received from Major General Sir William Grant Keir, that His Royal Highness the Prince [Ḥusayn ‘Alī Mīrzā, Governor of Fars] has disbanded his forces and given up his intentions regarding Bahrain. Bruce states that he went to Ahram to meet with the Prince, who had stopped there on his return to Sheeraz [Shiraz]. Bruce describes his initial meeting with the minister, before recounting his subsequent conversation with the Prince himself. The apparent reasons for the Prince postponing his expedition to Bahrain are the advanced state of the season and the Prince's suspicions regarding the sincerity of the Imam of Muscat [Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd]. Bruce states that he intends to send to His Royal Highness a suitable present to the amount of 4000 rupees.
